A pulse of 86/min, respiratory rate of 16/min, and a blood pressure of 146/90 mm Hg are observed. Auscultation of the chest reveals no abnormal findings. The patient’s ECG is difficult to interpret. It is not as specific as troponin. D. **Troponin T**: This protein is highly specific to cardiac muscle damage and is the most sensitive and specific marker for myocardial infarction. Elevated troponin levels are typically seen within 2-12 hours after MI and remain elevated for up to 10-14 days.
